content.text:
# Draft:Edward Gunawan

}}
Edward Gunawan  (b. 28 July 1982) is a Chinese Indonesian model, comic artist, actor and director.
Early life
Gunawan is born on 28 July 1982.  He was raised in a conservative Chinese family. In middle school he began coming out to his friends. He came out publicly when he moved to San Francisco, California. As a child, he enjoyed and Roald Dahl was his favourite author.
Career
Gunawan started his film career as a producer for the 2006 film Still, which was directed and co-produced by Lucky Kuswandi. In 2008, he produced Laundromat. The film was awarded Audience Award for Best Short Film in 18th ReelPride: Fresno LGBT Film and was nominated for the Jury Award For Best Director of Short Film Laundromat at the 19th Clip Tampa International Gay and Lesbian Film Festival. Payung Merah, a film he co-directed with Andri Cung in 2010, won at the Asian Short Film Awards in 2011. He was nominated for a Maya Awards for Best Newcomer in 2012 for his role in Arisan! 2. He produced Sagarmatha in 2013.
